Detailed Description

Function Documentation

BinaryPtr @109::concatenate ( std::vector< BinaryPtr > const &  buffers,
std::string const &  resCntStr 
) [static]

This concatinates a collection of BinaryBlocks into one big BinaryBlock.

We do this because when compressing to a PNG the call-backs give back multiple small buffers.

Parameters:
buffers A list of buffers to concatinate.
resCntStr A string for resource tracking.
Returns:
The concatinated buffers.

bool @109::isPower2 ( uint32  x  )  [static]

This returns true if x is a power of two.

Parameters:
x The number to test.
Returns:
True if the number is a power of two, false otherwise. Zero is not a power of two.

void @109::onPNGError ( png_structp  png_ptr,
png_const_charp  err_msg 
) [static]

Error callback for png_error().

We have to throw an exception here because you aren't allowed to return from a libpng error function (i.e. expect a segfault very shortly if you attempt to continue execution after this).

void @109::onPNGWarning ( png_structp  png_ptr,
png_const_charp  err_msg 
) [static]

Warning callback for png_warning().

void PNGAPI @109::pngReadBuffer ( png_structp  pngPtr,
png_bytep  bytes,
png_size_t  size 
) [static]

This is a libpng callback used during decompression.

It gets the decompresseor some raw data. We just move forward through an in-memory block of memory.

Parameters:
pngPtr Information about the PNG being decompressed.
bytes A pointer to a buffer to place compressed data.
size The requested size of the compressed data.

void PNGAPI @109::pngWriteBuffer ( png_structp  pngPtr,
png_bytep  bytes,
png_size_t  size 
) [static]

This is a libpng callback for writing out some compressed data.

Parameters:
pngPtr Information about the PNG being compressed.
bytes A pointer to some compressed data.
size The size of the compressed data.

void PNGAPI @109::pngWriteFlush ( png_structp   )  [static]

This is a libpng callback to signify the end of writing compressed data.

We do nothing, but we still need this function to use the user call-backs in libpng.
